stages.title: Define Your Biology Vision
stages.description: Clarify your interests in molecular biology, ecology, medicine, or research, and identify target universities.

Global.overview: Top biology programs value strong science foundations, research experience, and clear specialization interests. Start by mapping your interests.
checklist: Research 5-7 top biology programs (Harvard, Cambridge, MIT, Stanford, Oxford)
Identify your preferred field (molecular, ecology, genetics, medicine, biotechnology)
Assess your chemistry and math preparation
Write a 3-year academic and research roadmap

US.overview: US universities value strong academics plus research experience. Combine AP/IB rigor with lab work.
checklist: Research reach, target, and safety schools for biology
Note AP Biology and Chemistry requirements
Plan your Common App personal statement theme
Identify research opportunities or summer programs

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels and admissions tests. Focus on Biology, Chemistry, and BMAT/NSAA.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Oxford, Cambridge, Imperial
Start BMAT or NSAA preparation (Year 12)
Outline UCAS personal statement draft
Research UK biology program structures

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula to global standards while developing research mindset.
checklist: Review biology topics in IB HL or national exams
Identify international biology competitions (IBO, APhO)
Explore summer schools or research programs abroad
Document interest in specific biology fields

quiz.q: Which test is important for UK biology/medicine admissions?
What do US biology programs value most?
opts: Strong academics + research experience + lab work
quiz.correct: Strong academics + research experience + lab work

stages.title: Strengthen Academic & Research Foundation
stages.description: Excel in biology, chemistry, and math while gaining research experience.

Global.overview: Admissions officers look for rigorous science preparation and research involvement.
checklist: Complete advanced biology and chemistry coursework
Join biology competitions or research programs
Gain lab experience (school, university, or summer programs)
Track progress using an academic portfolio

US.overview: Prioritize AP Biology, Chemistry, and research-based extracurriculars.
checklist: Complete AP Biology and AP Chemistry
Join a research mentorship or lab program
Participate in science fairs or competitions
Document lab work in a portfolio

UK.overview: Excel in A-level Biology and Chemistry, prepare for BMAT/NSAA.
checklist: Achieve A* in A-level Biology and Chemistry
Solve 5 past BMAT or NSAA papers
Engage with practical biology challenges
Prepare for Oxbridge interviews

Asia.overview: Integrate biology excellence with national exams and Olympiads.
checklist: Complete IB HL Biology or equivalent
Take practice sets from IBO archives
Write reflection connecting biology to global challenges
Participate in local biology competitions

quiz.q: What's the best way to prove academic rigor in biology applications?
opts: Strong science results, lab experience, and research participation
quiz.correct: Strong science results, lab experience, and research participation

stages.title: Research, Projects & Impact
stages.description: Turn your curiosity into tangible research projects that impress admissions teams.

Global.overview: Admissions committees value originality â€” show it through hands-on biology research or interdisciplinary projects.
checklist: Design an independent biology experiment or research project
Document findings in a lab notebook or research report
Present your work (science fair, symposium, or online)
Collaborate with peers or mentors

resources.title: How to Create a Research Portfolio

projectIdeas: Study microbial diversity in local environments

US.overview: Link projects to summer research programs and college applications.
checklist: Apply to research programs (RSI, SIMR, or university labs)
Document lab work in a portfolio
Create a Common App project entry
Write research abstract or paper

UK.overview: Integrate projects into EPQ or UCAS statement.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on biology topic
Link project to university research themes
Include project outcomes in UCAS essays
Prepare to discuss research in interviews

Asia.overview: Use national fairs or Olympiad extensions to build portfolios.
checklist: Participate in local research competitions
Work under a university mentor
Translate project results into English
Connect to global biology challenges

quiz.q: What's the most impactful project for biology admissions?
opts: Original research with measurable outcomes and documentation
quiz.correct: Original research with measurable outcomes and documentation

stages.title: Craft Your Application Narrative
stages.description: Translate your academic and research experiences into compelling application materials.

Global.overview: Connect your curiosity and achievements into a cohesive personal story.
checklist: Write a 250-word draft personal statement
Ask mentors for feedback
Highlight research depth and impact
Connect biology to solving real-world problems

US.overview: Focus on Common App essays, recommendations, and activity descriptions.
checklist: Draft Common App essay with biology focus
Collect 2 recommendation letters (preferably from science teachers)
Optimize Activities section for clarity
Write supplemental essays

UK.overview: Refine UCAS statement and prepare for interview questions.
checklist: Complete UCAS personal statement drafts
Add reading and research activities
Prepare for Oxbridge interviews
Practice explaining research clearly

Asia.overview: Adapt statement for multiple university systems.
checklist: Prepare statement for both UCAS and Common App
Gather supporting documents
Draft reflection on biology career goals
Translate research documentation

quiz.q: What should your biology personal statement highlight?
opts: Curiosity, research depth, and connection to global challenges
quiz.correct: Curiosity, research depth, and connection to global challenges

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish your confidence and strategy for final submissions.

Global.overview: Bring together everything for confident applications.
checklist: Complete mock interviews
Submit all applications
Prepare to discuss research in detail
Celebrate your effort

US.overview: Rehearse storytelling for interviews and finalize applications.
checklist: Conduct mock interview with feedback
Submit Common App and supplements
Follow up with recommenders
Prepare research presentation if needed

UK.overview: Prepare for Oxbridge interviews with problem-solving sessions.
checklist: Review BMAT/NSAA-style interview problems
Simulate interviews under pressure
Practice explaining research clearly
Finalize UCAS submission
Confirm transcripts and research portfolios
Practice interview questions in English
Prepare to discuss research
Submit final applications

quiz.q: What's key for biology interview prep?
opts: Practicing explanation of research and scientific concepts
quiz.correct: Practicing explanation of research and scientific concepts
